cons:
Despite many reviews about long working hours at Shopee & Garena, I still gave it a try to interview and work here.
Since it's a start-up, scope of work is not clear, I often had to make extra effort to work, the work load is also overwhelming. That's why a lot of people have to work till late. Thus, there is no time for social life, work-life is not balance, especially not for who have kids.

headline: Good working environment
pros: Good working environment with not much office politics, young and vibrant office, lots of employee welfares and able to take charge of what you're doing
cons: startup working hours, lack of clear career progression, work can get quite overwhelming

headline: good for fresher
pros:
- young environment
- good salary
cons:
- messy process
- noisy working place

headline: Smart people, open culture
pros: It is nice to work with smart people, and you are free to voice out.
cons: structure is quite flat, working hour is usually long

headline: employees not very professional
pros: the corporate benefit is good
cons: management is not that good

headline: Data Analyst
pros:
- Challenging yet impactful projects
- Always-steep learning curve
- Smart colleagues
- Amazing office facilities 
- Many interest groups to join
cons:
- Long hours
- Higher ups like to talk harshly, sometimes demeaning other leader(s) in front of these leaders’ subordinates.
- No clear career path whatsoever, or at least different team leads have different understandings of this.
- Not enough L & D / Trainings, esp for the more specialized roles

headline: Good place for work
pros: A  lot of holidays and satisfied salary for a graduate student.  The environment is very good for me, a comfortable place for working.
cons: The interview may be difficult for a fresh graduate student.

headline: Fast growing
pros: No bureaucracy, a lot of new projects, good for self starters
cons: High expectation, lack of guidance/structure

headline: good
pros: good well very nice and fun
cons: its not good for carrer path

headline: CSO
pros: offered quite nice benefit package
cons: no concise career/work path

headline: Fast growing company
pros: surrounded by clever people so you can learn a lot.
cons: the management is not good.

headline: Fast growing but disorganized
pros: not much is set up so most projects feel impactful
cons: very top down, not much of a startup environment.

headline: Management Associate
pros: Colleagues are friendly and working environment is good.
cons: Lack of transparent career path and promotion process

headline: A fantastic company with fantastic people
pros:
- Very systematized, workflow is clear 
- Close with your superiors and  colleagues
- Working between divisions is very easy in terms of application and communication
cons: - Haven't found any cons at the moment

headline: Marketing Associate
pros:
Company takes care of employees' benefits and welfare by providing free dinner for those working late, free breakfast every Monday morning, tea time every Thursday and external team bonding events quite frequently. 

Fast paced environment, you're given an abundance of responsibility and trust to complete your respective tasks
cons: Could be stressful at times due to the fast paced environment and management can be quite demanding of their employees with high expectations set for every campaign.

headline: Underwhelming, messy structure and be careful who you are working for.
pros: Nice colleagues, nice environment. If you have a good boss, life is good.
cons: Parent company Seagroup has a huge control over Shopee, making some Shopee employees just executors.

headline: Suitable for people who is ok with obeying authority without question
pros:
Pantry with food and catered dinner if working overtime.
The company has a lot of young people so it's rather lively.
There is always a lot of work to do so if you take them on you get to learn a lot.
cons:
Management style is rather top-down.
Not everyone in the management are good at being leaders and building teams, which I think is essential for morale and culture. 
The company may be moving too fast and going through a lot of changes, so some disorganisation is warranted. (not recommended if you aren't tolerant of change)

headline: Dynamic, independent work culture
pros:
- A lot of freedom to build and start projects
- Great colleagues, welfare and environment
- Very little bureaucracy or red tape
cons: - Work-life balance can be tough sometimes but you're allowed to manage your own time so it's up to you to find that balance

headline: Business development
pros:
1. Good enviroment
2. Get Lunch
3. Free Snack
cons:
1. No career path
2. No life alance

headline: Fun and Energetic!
pros: Free dinner, open office concept, little to no politics.
cons: Less time for your love ones.

headline: China
pros: Good software developers, and highly motivated sales staff.
cons:
Immature CEO who is verbally abusive to staff, overpaid middle management drawn from a pool of ex-management consultants who provide questionable value. 

Very little career development as the company draws 100% of its middle management from external hires.

Internal culture is also very China-centric as all the top management of holding company Garena (other than figurehead Nick Nash) is drawn from mainland China.

headline: Young wild & free culture
pros: Culture and perks here is remarkable
cons: Limited career growth and there is plenty room to improve for HR

headline: You will learn a ton, but will get worn out pretty quickly
pros:
- Aggressive, analytical culture
- Management is focused on the things that matter to business growth
cons:
- Low employee sustainability
- Management prefers employees work long hours to prove their contribution

headline: Marketing Associate
pros: Great working culture, fast paced, plenty of learning opportunities
cons: Not a company that you can grow in a long term run

headline: Shopee - Buy and Sell anytime, anywhere!
pros: Fun, fast-paced environment with new challenges at every corner. Not one dull-day.
cons: Long working hours, an absence of work-life balance.

headline: Customer Service Associate
pros: Friendly and more relaxed environment as mostly everyone is youngters.
cons: Career progression and salary offer package has less potential

headline: Human Resource Associate
pros:
Dynamic Environment
Human Development
Good Compensation & Benefit
Youth Culture
cons: Needing to improve process workflow

headline: Transformative company
pros: Overall good community of employees who will welcome you and get to know you on your first day of work, HR who cares attentively to employee's needs, good office location
cons: Not much career advancement opportunities as most of decision making lies on the department heads. Sometimes executive tasks are all you're needed for. People also work very long hours.
